PASSED! This week, the House passed HR 3055 to fund key government agencies, including my amendment prohibiting individual-level census data to be shared with other federal agencies, like ICE. I fought for a budget that helps Coloradans & reflects our values, here are highlights:

Lawmakers, intelligence agencies, and the President’s Secretary of State agree: Russia tried to meddle in the 2016 election. We need to ensure that our elections are secure. Yesterday, the House passed the Securing America’s Elections Act to do just that. https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-congress/house-passes-bill-to-thwart-2020-ballot-box-hacking-idUSKCN1TS35M …

In the 50 years since Stonewall, a proud LGBTQ community has risked their lives fighting for their rights. Today, the fight continues with the transgender military ban and as 30 states still lack full protections from anti-LGBT discrimination. I’ll be there every step of the way.
Good luck #USWNT! #OneNationOneTeam

SCOTUS’s decision to block the citizenship question on the Census is a win for Colorado. A citizenship question would suppress the count and strain public resources. We cannot replace good governance with fear. https://www.denverpost.com/2019/06/27/supreme-court-blocks-census-citizenship-question/ …
I’m going to keep working with my caucus co-founders, @RepBrianFitz, @KenCalvert, and @RepTerriSewell, to support ALS research in the House.

ALS is a disease that knows no stranger. In my own family, we lost our dear cousin Jeff to the disease & studies show veterans of the Gulf War are 2x as likely to develop ALS. It is clear that more research needs to be done to understand this vicious disease and find a cure.

Last week, I spoke on the House Floor in support for more funding for ALS research. This week, I’m proud to announce that I just co-founded the ALS Caucus to improve treatment and help find a cure for the disease. pic.twitter.com/ZWnNVoyhiB

As a former Army Ranger, I’ve seen first hand the true cost of war and I refuse to let this country be dragged into another endless war. That’s why I’m helping co-lead a bipartisan amendment to prohibit the use of military force against Iran without congressional approval.

On Monday, President Trump said he doesn’t need authorization from Congress to begin military action in Iran. 

Since then, he’s said “I don't need exit strategies."

It was the catalyst for our post-war world, one built on the strength of our alliances and our shared commitment to democratic principles, bonds built on the battlefield. It is an honor to be in Normandy to ensure the sacrifices made 75 years ago are a part of our American story.

As a soldier, I think of the Rangers before me, the “boys of Pointe du Hoc.” Their valor inspires me, their sacrifice humbles me, and their commitment to our country reminds me of America’s unlimited potential when we come together to fight for a common purpose.

Seventy-five years ago today thousands of Americans put duty and sacrifice first and gave their lives on D-Day. They risked their lives to liberate Europe and protect freedom and democracy for future generations.
